metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26976 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: When a HTTPS pages was embedded in a HTTP page, and there was a service worker registered for the former, the service worker could have intercepted the request for the secure page despite the iframe not being a secure context due to the (insecure) framing. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 84.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
